TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AdminEventReceiver extends System.Object implements class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.IAdminEventReceiverRemote
Public MustInherit Class AdminEventReceiver Implements IAdminEventReceiverRemote

Docs.summary: Includes local event handlers for methods in the class, and remote event receivers for Admin (administrative) events in Project Web App.

remarks.para: Local event handlers can run only with an on-premises Project Server installation. Remote event receivers are designed to be used with Project Server apps, and can run with Project Online or with an on-premises installation.

For a list of the Admin events in Project Web App, see the Server Side Event Handlers page in SharePoint Central Administration (open General Application Settings, choose Manage under PWA Settings, and then choose Server Side Event Handlers under Operational Policies).

For information about creating a local event handler or a remote event receiver, see the Project Server event receivers section in What's new and what's out for developers in Project. See also How to: Create a Project Server Event Handler and Log an Event in the Project 2010 SDK.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnLineClassUpdated (Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo contextInfo, Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.LineClassPostUpdateEventArgs e);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnLineClassUpdated(class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo contextInfo, class Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.LineClassPostUpdateEventArgs e) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub OnLineClassUpdated (contextInfo As PSContextInfo, e As LineClassPostUpdateEventArgs)
public: virtual void OnLineClassUpdated(Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Library::PSContextInfo ^ contextInfo, Microsoft::Office::Project::Server::Events::LineClassPostUpdateEventArgs ^ e);

abstract member OnLineClassUpdated : Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo * Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.LineClassPostUpdateEventArgs -> unit override this.OnLineClassUpdated : Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Library.PSContextInfo * Microsoft.Office.Project.Server.Events.LineClassPostUpdateEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: Contains the Project Server context information.
The data for the event.
Docs.summary: A local post-event handler for the Admin – LineClassUpdated event, which occurs after Project Server updates a timesheet line classification.

remarks.para: The LineClassUpdated event occurs when a timesheet line is created, updated, or deleted. For example, when you change a timesheet line classification from Active to Inactive on the Line Classifications page in Project Web App, and then save the page, the LineClassUpdating and LineClassUpdated events are triggered.
The method triggers the LineClassUpdated event. The CSOM in Project Server 2013 does not include an equivalent Admin method.

Docs.param: Contains the Project Server context information.
The data for the event.
Docs.summary: A local post-event handler for the Admin – ReportingPeriodUpdated event, which occurs after Project Server updates a time reporting period.

remarks.para: The ReportingPeriodUpdated event occurs when a time reporting period is created, updated, or deleted. For example, when you change a reporting period from Open to Closed on the Time Reporting Periods page in Project Web App, and then save the page, the ReportingPeriodUpdating and ReportingPeriodUpdated events are triggered.
The method triggers the ReportingPeriodUpdated event. The CSOM in Project Server 2013 does not include an equivalent Admin method.

For example, when you change a reporting period from Open to Closed on the Time Reporting Periods page in Project Web App, and then save the page, the ReportingPeriodUpdating and ReportingPeriodUpdated events are triggered.
The method triggers the ReportingPeriodUpdated event. The CSOM in Project Server 2013 does not include an equivalent Admin method.
